text: Miguel Francisco Barragán Andrade (8 March 1789 – 1 March 1836) was a Mexican soldier and politician who served as interim president of Mexico in 1836. He had previously served as Governor of Veracruz, and gained national fame for the capture of the Fortress of San Juan de Ulúa in 1824, through which Spanish military presence was finally expelled from Mexico. Category:1789 births Category:1836 deaths Category:Presidents of Mexico Category:People from San Luis Potosí
title: Miguel Barragán
